inn1.comm: starts off very wide of off stump, back of a length and moving away further, left alone, not much bounce

and right away, Osinde strikes, bowled it fuller this time and much closer to off stumps, Ouma looked to leave it tentatively, there was sharp away movement which took the outside edge even as he looked to pull his bat away, and the ball settled in the palms of second slip
ooh, almost another one, it was on a length outside off stump again, straightened after pitching, Obuya went half-poking at it, but got nowhere near it
this one is wider outside off stump, and moving further away, left alone this time
shortens the length a tad, and it goes away after pitching, he leaves it alone
more away movement from close to off stump, not much bounce this time as it dies on its way to Bagai, Obuya pushed at it and was beaten
bowls it very full on the stumps, he digs it out back to the bowler
keeping it full around off stump, he gets forward and pushes it on the off side
he drops it shorter this time and gets it to move away wide outside off stump, left alone
good delivery, makes Waters go searching for it, and moves away from his bat after pitching on a length close to off
again the low bounce in the wicket reveals itself, another one outside off goes low to Bagai, left alone
the two opening bowlers have been very consistent in their first overs, another one moves away from a length outside off, and is left alone
Kenya are away, in the third over, it was wide and shortish outside off, he went for the cut but mistimed it, there was time though for a run as the ball went to the left of backward point
this one comes in with the angle from a length, he remains in the crease and works it away in front of square leg
making him push out at one that came in late from a length, it was very close to off stump, and just about missed the outside edge
more uncertain prodding outside off stump, he is caught on the crease, and is reaching out to the ones moving away outside off stump, beaten again
gets a fuller one outside off stump, and looks to thump it down the ground, but mistimes it to mid on
the one that comes in with the angle, good stuff from Osinde, he gets an inside edge through square leg as he pushes at it from the crease
what is happening here? another play and miss outside off stump, it was just around a length, and he went looking for the drive without moving his feet, beaten again
lovely delivery, straightening outside off stump, drawing the batsman forward who pushes at it, it zips past the outside edge
no movement on this one, comes straight on the stumps, blocked hurriedly
charges down the track this time, how long can one push and poke, gets it in front of square leg
short and wide, he goes hard at it, and gets it down to third man
opens the face of the bat to a length ball and runs it down to third man
clipped away off the pads towards midwicket
another mistimes shot, the ball came slowly off the pitch, he cut it hard in the ground and the ball rolled away to point
gets the timing on this one, cuts it off the back foot, but it is placed on the bounce to point
normal service resumes, one more play and miss, full and there for the drive, moves away slightly from the attempted one from Waters, and beats him

and the one that comes in as a surprise delivery gets him, Osinde likes it, it was pitched fuller and went on with the angle, Waters was tentative in pushing forward with all that away movement, and pushed outside the line, the ball raced through the gap between bat and pad, off the back pad and on to off stump which was uprooted out of the ground
139.4 kph delivery that goes on with the angle, makes him block it in a hurry
almost another one, gets the outside edge as he pushes hard off the back foot, but it falls well short of first slip
defended back to the bowler off the front foot
guided away wide of third man off the back foot
hustles this one from a length down to mid on, cannot get the placement right
squeezes out this very full and wide ball outside off stumps, and sends it down to third man
takes on the man at mid on with a chip in the air off a length delivery, gets it just over him as he goes running to his right, the outfield takes care of the rest
Osinde is bowling a lovely spell here, gets another one to go past the outside edge as he prods at an away going ball from the crease
this one comes in with the angle, keeping the batsman guessing, that's why he is caught on the crease and blocks it to mid on
goes on leg stump this time, and he flicks it with a Caribbean flourish through midwicket

makes a late decision to pull a surprise bouncer, gets it away through square leg, the man from fine leg put in the dive, but also touched the ropes at the last instant, was he touching the ball as well? Replays are not conclusive
i have lost count of the plays-and-misses in this short innings, he swishes at another one that moves away from a length outside off, and gets nowhere close to hitting it

Osinde gets another one, you cannot play-and-miss repeatedly, have to nick one in the end, that is what happened this time, it was pitched closer to off stump, making him push forward, and moved away late to take the edge on its way to Bagai, who pouches it very happily
beats him right away with one that turns away slightly close to off stump
this time he takes leave of the crease, comes down the track, and lifts this flighted one high over mid off
abandons the crease again, and goes for another charge, this one was a bit flatter and he takes it on the pads
is struck on the pads again, as he pushes at this one, but that one was going down leg
Collins sends this one in to orbit, gets to the pitch of the ball with a couple of steps, and hammers it over long off
pushes this flatter one back to the bowler from the crease
uses the angle on the incoming delivery to work it in to the gap between midwicket and mid on
solidly defended back to the bowler off the back foot
goes very full this time, he digs it comfortably in to the off side
sprays it very wide outside off stump this time from short of a length
played away off the back foot
comes forward to a fuller one and softly pushes it towards covers, looking much more comfortable that the ones that preceded him
miles outside the off stump from back of a length, he leaves it alone
fuller one outside off stump, pushed away to mid off
clipped away off the pads towards midwicket, the throw came in to the non-striker's end, but they had scampered through by then
calmly played away in to the covers off the front foot
opens the bat face to guide this to point, and they race through for the close run
driven to the right of mid on, and another single is available easily
nicely behind the line of this one close to off stump, and blocks it away
stretches and goes reaching for a wide one outside off stump, too wide for him even then
good delivery, going straight on instead of moving away, he was on the crease, and that allowed him to push it back to the bowler
gets forward and drives this full delivery past the non-striker for a single, mid on runs across to field
looking for the yorker, gets it very full on the stumps, he digs it away towards mid on
high full toss outside off stump, he is taken by surprise and cannot get it past mid off with the punch
slower one, very wide outside off stump, he reaches out and cuts it away awkwardly to point
played out to point off the back foot
tucks him up with a back of a length one on the stumps, he pushes it down the track
too straight this time, but he cannot get it past midwicket, even as he shuffles across the stumps and works it away

another one departs, what a shot to play when you are three down, went heaving at a length delivery from the crease, wanting to lift it over midwicket, got nowhere close to the ball, it seamed in a shade to beat him even more comprehensively, and crashed in to the stumps
gets a full toss on leg stump, happily pushes it in to the gap between midwicket and mid on, who had no chance on the Kotla outfield
gets the front foot across, and hurriedly brings bat in front of pad to turn this fuller one towards mid on
gets some room outside off stump, and steers it wide of third man
shoulders arms to one that comes in off the seam from a length close to off stump, good decision in the end
goes a touch wider than the previous one, still not far from off stump, and gets it to jag back in, Mishra persists with leaving
the closest to off stump of the three deliveries, Mishra has nothing to do with it, Osinde cannot understand how that missed off stump
gets it to angle in to the pads, Mishra was already coming forward and adjusted to flick it in the air, not far from the man at midwicket
goes very full this time, looking for the yorker, it is dug out towards mid on
gets forward now to one on a fuller length outside off stump, and meets with a firm defensive push
played out to cover off the back foot
guided to third man from the crease
that front foot goes a long way forward, and he has to stretch out to play around it and turn the incoming one in front of square leg
Tikolo finds the gap past extra cover, and beats mid off who puts in a vain dive, minimum of fuss, got behind this one outside off stump, and pushed it firmly in the gap
blocked off the front foot, bat and pad close together
guided towards point from the crease

gets it to angle on to leg stump, strikes him on the pads as he pushes across the line, Cheema thinks he is on to something, the umpire is not interested, Bagai goes for the review, replays show that it is missing leg stump comfortably, Canada lose a review
comes on slowly off the pitch, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
takes on mid on with a quick single, he was gone if the throw had hit at the non-striker's end, easily
gets forward languidly to one outside off stump, and pushes it towards covers
turned backward of square leg, fine leg runs across to field

Cheema gets his man, or has he? Kenya's turn to review a leg-before decision that was given out, it was cutting in from the seam, struck him in the line of off stump, that would have gone on to hit middle stump, but Tikolo managed to get an inside edge on it before it struck the pad, but apparently the third umpire wanted clearer proof of there having been an inside edge, HotSpot would have confirmed it, but it isn't there, the decision stands, and Steve Tikolo has to walk back
tossed up and turning into the pads, paddled to backward square leg for one
Kamande is away with an outside edge squeezed down to third man. Hansra tosses up wide outside the off side and Kamande goes for the cover drive. Won't mind where it went, it got him four
holds the length back and he leans out to defend to the off side
similar ball, turning in from outside off, Kamande fends to the off side
he's skipping around in the crease, looking to advance, but Hansra keeps him honest with a flatter line on off stump
tossed up slower, Kamande leans out and defends to the off side
huge inducker, Cheema gets it nip back sharply from well outside off and Mishra had to abort ambitious of the booming cut and squeeze it off the face to third man
another one comes in off the seam, Kamande reaches out and defends
slowish offcutter, 109 kph and comes later than Kamande expects, he barely keeps it down as he pushes into the off side
back of a length outside off, he goes for the cut and finds point
aha, another one that comes in, daring leave from Kamande and it slithers past just outside off
he's not picking Cheema at all, another one nips in, misses the inside edge as he goes for an ambitious cut.
short ball outside off, wasted by Mishra who cuts it straight to point
back of a length on off stump, defended with the spin to mid on
wider outside off this time, Mishra tries to force through the straight field but the bowler is in the way
tossed up more generously, stout forward defensive from Mishra
this one drips into the stumps, it is clipped to the leg side for one
and he finishes with a controlled sweep to backward square leg. Covers the line and rolls the wrists over the shot for one
short of a length outside off from Cheema, Kamande slaps it to point
plays forward with an opened face to a fuller length ball, worked straight to point
slower ball, lands, grips, stops and spits at Kamande who defends uncertainly off the front foot
holds the length further back, Kamande hangs back and defends to the off side
Cheema again gets some inward curve, Kamande presses across and covers the deviation to defend. Absolutely NO intention to score as of now.
and he flashes unconvincingly at the last ball, short and drifting away from off stump. Feet rooted to the crease, he flails at it and misses.
surprise, surprise, a decisive hit for four. Tossed up invitingly outside off, Mishra plants the front foot well across and swipes with power through midwicket.
another good shot from Mishra, similar ball, he gets to the pitch and drives into the covers, through a slow moving Osinde, for a couple
over-pitched on the stumps, it is dug back down the track to the bowler
holds it back outside off and Mishra opens the face as he defends square on the off side
the front foot is finally moving, again Mishra gets across to the flight and dinks to midwicket for a single
surprise full toss on the hips, surely caught the batsman by surprise and he clipped it to midwicket for one
yorker on the leg stump, dug out just in time to the leg side
back of a length on off stump, played into the off side from the crease
that's a Kotla special. The grubber that scoots through at shin height. Kamande does well to get bat on it with a late crouch

four for Kamande, and comes through a rather pleasing shot. Cheema helped the cause by over-cooking a yorker and delivering a mfull toss on leg stump. Kamande just drove cleanly with the full face to get four through long on.
shortens the length and lands it outside off this time, Kamande lets it go
fuller length to end the over, Kamande comes forward and defends down the track
begins with a ball close to being wided as it slips down the leg side.
short of a length and turning away, Mishra looks to pull and gets a single
lands it closer to the length he should be focusing on, Kamande stays back though and pushes to the covers
flipper of sorts, skids through on off stump line and it is just about played out to the off side
flighted slowly in the air, Kamande reaches out to defend
sprightly leggie to end the over, delivered from the line of the stumps, and breaking away sharply from off stump, past Kamande's waft and into Bagai's quick gloves.
over-pitched well outside off, Mishra jams it down to third man for one
tight run thing, this. Kamande pushes a full ball firmly to mid on and takes off. A direct hit might have got him, despite the sprawling dive.
short ball outside off, Mishra looks to cut and gets a thick edge down to third man, but there is protection
slower ball, offcutter at 113 kph, defended carefully to the off side
pleasing drive, but he finds the fielder. Cheema over-pitches on leg stump and Kamande's smooth on-drive is intercepted at mid on
another mysterious offcutter from Cheema, nearly cuts the Kenya captain in half as he thinks of gliding it fine.
tossed up on off stump, defended compactly off the front foot
on the pads, and Mishra dabs to midwicket for a quick single
googly comes out well, lands outside off and breaks in. Kamande looks chuffed that he managed to pick it and defend!
this one breaks the other way, Kamande stays stuck to the crease and tries to cut. And misses.
too short, Kamande is taken by surprise and is late on the pull. He bottom edges it towards wide mid on
another short ball, this time Mishra latches on late and under-edges through mid on for a single
turning in from wide of the stumps, punched into the covers for one
tossed up wide of the stumps, Kamande dabs it along to third man
goes for a big sweep and gets a top edge. Thankfully for Kenya, it doesn't carry to the man at deep square leg
Mishra tries to winkle a square drive off a delivery tossed up outside off, but finds the fielder
flatter and straighter, punched down the ground for a single
Kamanda strays out of the crease and tries some kind of a shot to the leg side and gets a leading edge towards point.
turning into the stumps from outside leg, tucked through square leg for one
tossed up and quicker, hurries into Kamande who somehow managed to poke it to the off side

lovely bowling, tossed up outside off and inviting the drive, spinning prodigiously past the outside egde. Kamande did well to keep the back foot inside the crease, Bagai was quick to whip the bails off
flatter on off stump and turning away, pushed with the opened face towards point
speared onto the pads, whipped through midwicket for a single
hurries through outside off, a hint of low bounce too as Mishra looks to chop and misses
speared helpfully on the pads from round the wicket, worked through midwicket for a single

a rare boundary for Kenya. Mishra gets another fastish delivery from Davison, wasted as it drifts down the leg side, and he lap sweeps it well, taking care to get it finer than the man at short fine leg. Away for four.
Mishra advances to the flight of the ball and drives through mid on for a single
short of a length on off stump, Kamande looks to bustle out of the crease and dab to the off side
straighter this time, on the stumps and played back to the bowler
some poor lines here from Davison. Another one landed on the leg stump and Kamande goes for the comprehensive sweep through square leg. Only a single on offer though.
full toss from Rao, on the off stump and wasted. The drive is played straight to mid off
Kamande all at sea. Tries to open the face and somehow make contact with a legspinner. You guess right, he missed.
now he gets bat on ball, steering into the off side for a single
length ball on off stump, Mishra presses forward ans softly drops it on the leg side for a single
Kamande leaps out to off stump and looks for the leg side hoick, but Rao keeps it outside off stump and foils his plans
whoa, what happened there? Rao slips this down the leg side, it lands well outside leg and turns sharply, missed the leg stump and ran away through Bagai's legs down to third man.
speared onto the toes, dinked towards midwicket for one
bustles in on a full length, on the leg stump at 123 kph and driven to mid off

take that. Kamande has struggled against spin, and clearly prefers pace on the ball. This was just short of a length and coming into his body, Kamande responded by standing tall and smacking the pull between mid on and midwicket. Dismissive.
Osinde adjusts line and length, gets this outside off at the un-pullable, un-drivable length. Kamande defends to the off side
this one keeps low after landing back of a length outside off, and Kamande misses the cut
another one keeps low outside off, Kamande looks to cut and then bends low at the last moment to play it out to the off side
ends with one back of a length on off stump and it is defended from the crease to the off side
leggie on the pads, clipped through square leg for one

Rao has struck, and Kamande's woes against spin come to an end. Short ball, landed close to his own half, and turning away from Kamande. He went for the cut, and if anything, seems to have been caught out by the extra bounce. Poor feet movement did not help his cause. He was rooted to where he took guard and went at it hard. He gets a faint edge on the cut, and Bagai pouches it well.
Rao welcomes him with a googly well outside off, and Odoyo leans out to smother the turn
another wrong 'un, Odoyo leans out and defends from the crease
Odoyo turns one on the pads to the leg side for one
straight and sharp, on middle stump and defended down the track

this time he strays on the pads, and Odoyo plays a nice flick through square leg. Rao is in the thick of things, running in from deep fine leg and diving away like a Bollywood hero's stunt double would, and he is sprawling on the ropes as the ball trickles past.
length ball on off stump, defended down the track

poor throw saves Mishra. It wasn't a throw, as much as an under-arm coaxing of the ball, back at Bagai. Odoyo dinked it to the off side and took off, the fielder had the time to line up a good throw but chose to under-arm flick it. That allowed Mishra enough time to get in.
on the pads to end the over, Mishra flicks straight to midwicket
full length ball on off stump, driven down to long on for one
tossed up and turning away, he pushes forward for an off drive
Rao rips another one across, but Odoyo smothers the spin well with a solid forward press
shorter this time, Odoyo looks to work it to the off side with the spin, but can't get the gap
unnecessary direct hit allows a third. Odoya stays back and punches through midwicket for a couple. And then he gets a third.
short of a length again, Mishra works through the leg side for one more
back of a length on the pads, worked with the pads through the leg side for one
back of a length on off stump, defended back down the track
this one is speared onto the pads and is worked through square leg for one.
looped up on off stump, dabbed into the off side for a single
flighted on leg stump, and Mishra drives down the leg side for one
tossed up on off and middle, he leans out and defends down the track
loopy full legbreak, he comes forward and pushes to the off side
gets away with a low and slow short one that is cut away to point
tosses it up outside leg stump, and it is worked away to deep midwicket
short and turning away, cut away towards extra cover
gets right to the pitch of this tossed up delivery outside off stump, and drives it straight to extra cover
well bowled, flighted up even further, and closer to off stump this time, he goes for another drive and is beaten
goes on straight outside off stump, keeps low, pushed away to extra cover
another one keeps very low outside off stump, turns away from the edge, Bagai manages to get some glove on it
defended off the front foot
Odoyo comes charging down the track, gets to the pitch and lifts this tossed up one with the turn over extra cover, one bounce over the ropes
goes for the cut to a delivery that is very close to off stump, and underedges it
down the legside, he looks to work it fine but misses
flighted up on leg stump, he reaches out to smother it
gets an inside edge on the leg side for a single as he stretches forward
tossed up with an invite to drive through extra cover with slip waiting, he does so, but very softly and along the ground
flatter and quicker, he goes back to defend down the pitch
another shortish one, hurries on after pitching, he hammers it away wide of midwicket
gets to the pitch of a flighted one outside off and drives it along the ground to long off
turning down the pads, turned behind square leg
slow and low one on the leg stump, he pushes hard at it, and it goes in the air just wide of the man at midwicket
comes down the track, almost yorks himself and digs it away back to the bowler
gets some width outside off and cuts it backward of point, a fumble close to the ropes concedes an extra run
pushed away in front of covers off the front foot
quicker one on the pads, turned to midwicket, Mishra wants a run, Odoyo sends him back
shortish and hurrying straight on with the angle, he shuffles and takes it on the pads
tossed up on middle stump, and he gets forward to defend
pushed in quicker, he hurries forward in defence on the off side
looks to tickle one fine on the off side, but cannot get it past Bagai
full on leg stump, swept away wide of deep square leg
tossed up fuller, he goes back in the crease and turns it square
length ball on the stumps, blocked down the track off the back foot
Odoyo gets the timing perfect on this one, it was fuller and he came forward confidently to meet it with a straight bat and sent it racing past extra cover, and it was too quick for long off
played away in front of point off the back foot
gets forward for another drive along the ground. this time to sweeper cover
gets it to jag back in from a length outside off stump, he works it with the movement to midwicket
punched off the back foot, but finds midwicket in the way
again Odoyo gets on the front foot and pings sweeper cover with the drive
paddles this one on leg stump fine, but short fine leg gets to the ball with a big dive, it is big Osinde there
goes for the slog sweep, it was the googly, he picked it and hammered it with the turn beyond cow corner
pushed in front of square leg for a run
Mishra uses the feet to get to the pitch, and drives it down to long on
eased with the turn on the off side, extra cover dives to cut off the single
very full outside off stump, he goes down on a knee and squeezes it down to third man
shot! it was slapped away past extra cover off the front foot, it was very full close to off stump, and went through with the full bat swing, beating sweeper cover to the boundary
bowls it shorter this time, slower too, he stays in the crease and pushes it on the off side
shuffles across the stumps, Cheema goes in the blockhole, and he digs it back to the bowler
Odoyo stands on the back foot, and forcefully punches this to extra cover, who parries the ball in the direction of long off with the dive. some slow work there allows Odoyo to get back in time
hurries him in to nudging this one away on the leg side
very wide outside off stump, almost outside the pitch, goes on a couple of bounces to Bagai
turns this back of a length delivery coming in with the angle to midwicket
pushes this one outside off stump away to point, there was some width there but he hit it to the fielder
steers a wide delivery uppishly in the direction of third man, goes to him on the bounce, Mishra has 50
low full toss outside off stump, he looked to drive it but it went off the edge on the bounce to the keeper
reaches out to push at this widish one, it is bowled a tad slower and he gets it in the air just wide of point
looks to forcefully drive this fuller one past midwicket, but Balaji pulls off a diving stop in that region

Davison comes on and gets Mishra right away, lured him down the track with a flighted one from round the wicket, he got too close to the delivery and had a go at it, ending up getting a leading edge which went safely in the hands of mid off, this is a big wicket at this stage
gets a healthy edge as he pushes half-forward and it races past short third man who gives chase and pulls it back
goes reaching out very far for another one going across him, and is beaten
pushed away in to the off side
tossed up on a yorker length, he digs it out, and it rolls away towards slip
shortish and turning on the pads, he works it away in front of square leg
Osinde charges in and bowls one short and wide outside off stump, he goes for the cut and is beaten
goes for the yorker, it swings in the air on leg stump, lovely delivery, he somehow manages to dig it away on the leg side

well, Bagai and Osinde think that Odoyo edged this attempted drive, Bagai dived forward to take it, Odoyo seemed to start walking back, but umpire Rauf thinks there was nothing on that, did it carry? Might have not
chopped away in the direction of third man
Osinde gets another yorker on target, it gets between Odhiambo's swish and the leg stump, Bagai again thinks there was an edge involved

and now he gets it in a place where appeals don't matter, even as Odhiambo went swishing again, this time the yorker was spot-on, crashing in to the stumps, Osinde has four with the last ball of his tenth over
worked away backward of square leg off the back foot
pushes inside the line of this one going across him, how did that miss off stump?
pushed back to the bowler
this one is floated up wide outside off stump, another swish in the air
gets bat to ball now, sends a fuller one along the ground to sweeper cover
Odoyo is stepping it up with wickets falling at the other end, takes a step down the track, and powers this one high over long off, just muscled over the ropes
full and wide down the leg side, Odoyo went for the fine tickle but missed out
gets it on a length on the stumps, pushed away to deep midwicket

Baidwan goes for the appeal, it was a fuller one that struck him on the pads as he missed out on the flick, umpire Rauf says no, Canada go for the review, it is just clipping the leg stump, and the on-field call stays, Odoyo survives
goes for the cut to one that is not short enough outside off, and misses
goes for the yorker, it reverses in late, and somehow manages to miss off stump, almost grazed it on its way to the keeper, Otieno was in no position to get bat on ball
rolls away on the leg side as he is hit high on the pads
no room for Odoyo, this one keeps low as well, he shuffles and pushes it back to the bowler
looks to belt this one down the ground, but gets it as far as the bowler
Odoyo lives on again, he had backed up too far down the pitch, it was hit to midwicket who missed the non-striker's stumps by a long way
heaved away over midwicket to bring Odoyo on strike
makes room outside leg stump, Baidwan goes wider outside off stump, and it crashes into Bagai's gloves who thinks there was an edge before that, but the umpire doesn't think so
lovely delivery, nothing can be done with that, in the blockhole and dug back to the bowler
another one fired full on the stumps, pushed away in to the off side for a run
Odoyo goes a mile down leg, sees the ball has followed him there, gets it off the pads towards square leg
heaved away towards deep midwicket
this is super stuff from Canada, this is anything but a batting Powerplay, fired outside off stump, he had backed away down leg and missed
cannot get this one away as well, and they still call it a batting Powerplay
manages to push this one to mid off and gets across for the single
the slower one, had he hit that, it would have carried to the other side of the Yamuna, but he did not connect, the ball moved away past the bat, and the stumps, Bagai is not happy by the latter fact
goes down on a knee and paddles a full toss straight to short fine leg
they get the single now, this one is pushed down the ground past the bowler
the ball does not want to go past the infield, a full toss is slapped away to point
the old slog gets some runs finally, he made some room and gave it a thwack, the extra bounce on that one took the outside edge and flew wide of short third man
back to normal, full delivery outside off stump, can't do anything with it

Hansra denies Kenya a six, it was slogged again, and this time he got the connection, it flew high in the air and settled in the hands of Hansra at wide long on who was about half an inch from the ropes, talk about being in the right place at the right time, they look at the replays before confirming that it was clean
Odoyo gets 50, flicks a full toss off the pads through square leg
they go up for the leg before, it reversed in late and struck him on the pads, sliding down leg as they steal a leg bye as it rolls away
gets just the single, comes down the track, he bowls it slower and shorter, and he pushes it away to long on
sprays a full delivery down the leg side
gets the slower one on target, Ngoche is surprised and just pats it back down the track, Canada have been superb in this Powerplay
hammered away off the front foot to the man at mid off, Odoypo gets one last ball

what a delivery! Odoyo is on all fours, and the stumps are shattered, again he gets the late inward movement as Odoyo backs away and looks to heave it down the ground, the ball tails in past his bat and crashes into the base of the stumps, 19 for 2 off the batting Powerplay

inn2.comm: length ball angling across at 127 kph to begin with, pushed off the front foot towards mid off for one

Odoyo has got an lbw appeal upheld by Umpire Doctrove. Is Cheema gone first ball? He's refering it. Bustling inducker, lands outside off and nips in nicely. Cheema is only half forward and it would be dead plumb if it hits the pads first ... but it doesn't. Huge inside edge on that, Cheema had a smile when he reviewed it. He knew he was safe.
another one back of a length and coming in, Cheema doesn't quite move the feet anywhere as he sets himself up for a booming drive. Ends up defending to the off side

there's an unidentified flying object over the Delhi skies. No wait, that's a cricket ball. Odoyo delivers a juicy slower ball on the driving length, Cheema gets under it and sky-rockets it into orbit. Mid off runs back, but can't get there by the time the ball begins its descent to our planet.
Cheema is going for them here. Another length ball outside off, Cheema gets under it and hoicks free-spiritedly over cover point. It lands safe and trickles over the ropes
Cheema ain't waiting for no one. Another length ball, comes in and cramps him for the shot but he goes for the swivel swipe through the leg side. Edges it onto the pads.
driving length ball angling across Ruvindu who drives straight to short cover
even fuller outside off, Ruvindu forces the drive past the short cover fielder, but doesn't get a single
he's timing these cover drives alright, but needs the placement. Driven crisply but straight to short cover
thrown wider outside off at 134 kph, Ruvindu slashes at it with a half strut forward, and misses
short of a length this time, Ruvindu gets the full face of the blade on it and drives to mid off
spoils a potential maiden by over-stepping off the last ball. Back of a length and played back to the bowler. Ruvindu will wind up now for a big swing.
goes for the short ball outside off, Ruvindu was fooled by the length and missed his late attempt to pull though the body balance was going forward.
back of a length, menacing feet movement from Cheema, looks like he wants to paste it through the off side, but ends up defending
slower ball, comes off the back of the hand and befuddles Cheema who is looking to bang the pull shot to the leg side. He gets a bottom edge, on the bounce to the keeper
Odoyo keeps the line very tight, angling into Cheema from short of driving length and Cheema can't do much with it. He forces it back down the track
this time he manages to punch into the covers for a single.
over-pitched outside off, Ruvindu has played several shots outside the off stump without getting any returns. Another swing, another miss.
good delivery, after angling several across him, Odoyo gets one to hold its line and finish on middle and off, Ruvindu plants the front foot across and defends into the covers

drop-kicked out of the field. Cheema flexes his muscle with a strong swing over midwicket. Elijah plays into his hands by delivering a length ball coming in with the angle. Cheema helps it along, with interest. Powerful swing that.

Elijah is losing the script here. Now he drops short, which is not a bad idea, but he also strays into Cheema's body. His natural stance already has him inside the line and he merrily pulls it finer than short fine leg for four more.
slower ball, 121 kph, Cheema was planning to send this away through the leg side as well, but seeing it was coming slow he decided to spare it.

Elijah has struck. He runs around in glee, pumps his fist and then pulls up his tee shirt to cover his mouth! Some celebration that. Cheema was looking to blast everything out of his presence, and one of them has found its way past him. Short ball, not there for the drive. Not quite there for the pull. Cheema was on the front foot again and went for an ungainly heave across the line. Miss. Leg stump splatters. Elijah is delighted.
back of the hand loopy slower one first up, Surkari gropes outside off and can't get bat on it
angles in towards the pads from wide of the crease, Surkari solidly defends down the track
folater angling across Ruvindu who defends off the front foot into the leg side
Ruvindu again plants the front foot across and check drives between short cover and the bowler, for a single to mid off.
126.8 kph, Surkari pushes down the track and outside the line but Odoyo keeps this back of a length and forces the defensive shot
Odoyo drifts onto the pads and Surkari is away with a neat defelction through square leg for one
back of a length again to the right hander, he reaches across to defend to the off side
on the pads to end the over, a needless throw from Waters hits the stumps and allows a single. It was flicked straight to him at midwicket. Free runs, flowing like waters.
Elijah is up in appeal again, as he gets an inducker to ping Surkari high on the front pad. Too much doubt there - height, line, and a possible inside egde too.
this one swerves even more prodigiously into the pads, and Surkari misses the flick.
redirects this one around off stump, at 130 kph, and Surkari defends off the front foot into the covers
shortens the length further and hits Surkari's bat close to the splice as he plays forward instead of back.

even better appeal, Surkari is well down the pitch this time as he tries to work it across the line. Kenya have decided to review the lbw appeal that was turned down. Back of a length, and as always coming in sharply. Surkari is at least two feet out of the crease as he tries to turn it around, across the line to the leg side. Hits in line with off, and the dodgy prediction (since this is over 2.5m) says this is hitting middle and leg. Over to the on-field umpire, and Asad Rauf retains his original call.
ends with another delivery bending in, fuller length and it is pushed from the crease to mid on for a single
back of a length from Odoyo, lands outside off and comes in slightly. Surkari gets outside the line and defends to the off side
legcutter, stays a touch low as it comes through at 120 kph, Surkari manages to defend
aha, Surkari jumps out and looks for the drive through the off side, but the ball sneaks past the bat and pad gap, outside off and through to the keeper
tight line, on middle and off, Surkari stays in the crease and covers the line well
another back of the hand legcutter, ends up outside off and is steered backward of point. Can't get a single.
again, Odoyo is needling away here with some tight lines, Surkari defends off the front foot to the off side
Ruvindu looks quite edgy outside off stump, this time he tries to play for the one that straightens even as Elijah gets one to angle across and ends up outside-edging backward of point
comes in from outside off stump, Surkari taps to the leg side for a single
Kotla, oh Kotla. Another one stays low as it goes through outside off stump. Ruvindu, as always swipes hard and misses.
another perfectly flowing cover drive from Ruvindu. When he times them, they find the fielder. This time, he pings cover.
another one slides across the bat's face, Ruvindu keeps feeling for them outside off. This one misses the dge closely

Ruvindu breaks free with a pleasing drive down the ground. That was punched on the up as Elijah cramped him for room on off stump, Ruvindu just took a half step forward and met it on the rise. Crisp and comprehensive.
slower ball outside off, Surkari is early on the drive and gets an inside edge onto the leg side.
again, Odoyo is keeping it very tight. On the middle stump, Surkari again mistimes the drive and finds mid on
hint of width outside off this time, and Ruvindu steers fluently through backward point for a single
over-pitched outside off, Ruvindu can't get under it and drives without power to mid off. He went at it hard without moving the feet across.
good work from Kamande at mid off. Over-pitched outside off, Ruvindu times the off drive well and Kamande hurries to his left and slides to save the boundary.

Surkari plays the shot of the innings. Marginally short, but he seemed to pick the length even before Odoyo was in his delivery stride. Hangs back in the crease, hooks the left knee and pulls emphatically through midwicket for four
bustling across the batsman, Ruvindu works it from off stump to the leg side
Ruvindu continues to swing hard outside off, he doesn't get his feet across, and gets an inside edge through backward square leg.
over-pitched on off stump, worked with the angle to mid on
again sharp anmgle comes into the right hander who pushes it to mid on with a straight bat

This could be curtains for Surkari. The difference between these teams could be the fielding. Kamande is the man on the move again, and he's hit the stumps down at the bowler's end. Similar ball, comes in with the angle, and Surkari bunts to the leg side and takes off. Kamande prowls in quickly, picks up on the move and has a shy at the bowler's end. Surkari was half a foot short.
Ruvindu smacks one through the off side, and for a change he makes good connection. Over-pitched outside off, he reached across to the pitch of it and creams it through the covers.
back of a length outside off and another one that stays low. Bagai looks to cut and gets a nervy bottom edge. Close to the stumps ..

how lucky is that? Ruvindu was days early on the flick, and got a leading edge that popped straight up over Odhiambo's head and landed near the stumps at the non-striker's end. Mid on and Mid off charged in, but the ball had long since landed.
gets behind the line this time and defends down the track

lovely timing from Ruvindu. He's walked inside the line to a length ball on middle and leg and whipped it gracefully through midwicket. Smooth as whipped cream. Smooth as this simile was initially intended to be.

Odhiambo drops a quintessential tracer bullet. Length ball on the middle and leg stump, Ruvindu drills it straight back, and Odhiambo did well to ensure none of his bones cracked, as he fended the ball away from him.
length ball again, on off stump and punched to mid off for a single

This is Bizarroworld. Ruvindu might be out stumped. Shambles from Ruvindu. Shambles from Ouma. Shambles all round. Stupidity, says Ian Chappell. It slips down the leg side. Ruvindu misses the flick. And looks back. He can't see the ball. He thinks it has trickled away to fine leg. Ouma, cunningly, hid the ball in his left glove. Once Ruvindu strayed out of the crease, Ouma looked to flick the bails off. And missed! He then flicked again. This time he hits the stumps. Ruvindu is still not in! Haven't seen something so bizarre from a batsmen since Inzamam tumbled onto his stumps, attempting to sweep Panesar.
tossed up on middle and off, worked with the spin to mid on

Hansra just told Waters, "Mate you just caught the wooden spoon". Tossed up generously outside off, Hansra inexplicably looks to bang it down the ground. He doesn't time it at all, and it is a dolly to mid on. Waters drops it. In and out.
Hansra is away, solid punch through point for four. Had this under control, but Ngoche helped by dropping short
this one turns in sharply, Hansra works it to the leg side
Hansra makes solid connection to another flighted ball outside off, gets under it, goes on a knee and launches it almost all the way over long off

Bagai summons his inner Laxman and plays a rather pleasing straight push-drive down the ground. Full length ball on the stumps, he stays in the crease and coaxes it with a flick of the wrists, straight back down the ground for four
this one stays low on middle and off, Bagai gets behind the line and keeps it out.
again stays low on the stumps, Bagai plays back - he should consider pushing forward on this pitch. Defended off the lower end of the bat down the pitch
this one comes in with the angle into the pads, Bagai works it off leg stump to mid on
another one that doesn't quite rise in line with off stump, Bagai stays on the crease down the track
worked away with the angle in front of square
tossed up and breaking in, Hansra leans out and defends to the off side
back of a length and turning in, he hangs back and works it to leg side
leans out to a flighted ball outside off, defended to the off side
aha, Hansra jumps out of the crease, and gets too close to the pitch of the ball. Ends up under-edging it onto the boot.
stays inside the line and clips with the angle to the leg side
fired in fast on the stumps, he pushes outside the line and defends down the track
sends in a length delivery around off stump, and he comes forward to defend
strides out and meets this back of a length ball outside off, but his solid push finds short extra cover
full on the pads, flicked away through square leg
pushed away towards extra cover off the back foot
gets some width outside off stump, and uses it deftly, steers it fine and third man was too square to cut it off
flat and full around off, pushed back to the bowler
turning down the pads, worked away straight to midwicket off the back foot
sharp turn for Ngoche, he came forward and got an inside edge on the leg side
this one goes flat and straight outside off, cut away to point
tossed up a tad now, he stretches out and turns it on the leg side
very full outside off stump, he gets too close to the pitch of the ball and mistimes the drive towards short extra cover
angles in to the batsman fro a length, he is caught on the crease and pushes it back hurriedly
whips away a length ball in front of square leg
pushes this one around off towards point and sets off for a run as an afterthought, but is sent back rightly
slower one, comes even more slowly off the pitch, he drops it in front of point, but there is no chance of a run
now he will get the single, works away a back of a length one on leg stump towards square leg
lovely delivery to finish with, targetting the zone just outside off stump, he comes forward and blocks
leans out and pushes one down the track
comes down the track and drives with the turn towards deep midwicket
shot! he had made up his mind, and made some room outside leg stump, took it on the half volley and smashed it over extra cover
slowly tossed up outside off, pushed in to the off side close to point
shortish and turning in, punched away to extra cover
punched away towards midwicket off the back foot
opens the face to guide one past a diving backward point towards third man
comes forward and looks to set off for the single with a push towards cover, but decides against it in the end
very full outside off stump, he wanted to go for the cover drive, but got an inside edge back to the bowler
full slower one around off stump, calmly pushed away towards extra cover, they are not taking any risks
whipped away off the back foot down the track, he would have liked to go wide of mid on
turned away off the back foot, this time to midwicket, Odhiambo has been pretty tidy
fired down the leg side, it is tickled away to short fine leg
tossed up around off stump, played with the turn on the leg side
tossed up still slower now, and turned away to midwicket
uses the wrists to work this one wide of midwicket this time
fired in on the off stump, calmly patted away on the leg side
cannot get this one past midwicket again, tight first over from Kamande
shortish delivery, does not get up much, he goes for the pull all over it, Ouma misses on the take as it bounces in front
gets this one outside off stump, slashed away down to third man
gets forward and pushes this one towards extra cover
played back to the bowler
driven firmly off the front foot but mid off easily cuts it off
gets forward and drives wide of cover, who dives and half-stops the ball
gets down the track and takes this one on the half volley but his drive finds extra cover
cut away to point off the back foot
gets a leading edge as he looks to turn this one on the leg side
pushed back to the bowler
pushed through wide of leg stump, turns further away and Ouma fails to take it
played with the turn to midwicket who races to his right, stops the ball, and fires in the throw
comes forward to one that is tossed up a tad and plays it out on the leg side
flighted up very slowly, he takes it on the half volley and drives down to long off
goes straight on around off stump, played out towards extra cover
gets him to drive off the front foot, and then dives to his left to save a single
goes on the leg stump this time, he gets back and whips it down to fine leg
cut away off the back foot to sweeper cover, not much turn for Obuya
flighted up nicely, but way down the leg side, Ouma collects it cleanly now
short and turning away slightly, cut away wide of sweeper cover
pushed away with the turn to mid on
flicked away down to fine leg off the back foot
pushed through quickly, he comes forward and drives down the ground
full around off stump, turned to midwicket off the front foot
flicked away down to fine leg, too much leg side stuff from Kamande
better, floated up around off stump, he pushes it back to the bowler
short and turning away from Bagai, who rocks back and cuts it to sweeper cover
low full toss, pushed straight back to the bowler, and it goes right between Obuya's hands, and through his legs
drops it somewhat short and it is enough for him to cut away to sweeper cover
hurries on after pitching outside off stump, but still short enough to be cut to sweeper cover, runs coming very easily
now he goes down the leg side, and it is ticked fine for another coupls
Obuya is being milked all around, this time he is cut to the right of sweeper cover
nudged through square leg with the turn
takes a step towards the ball and lifts it down the ground, it falls short of Waters at long on
Waters it is again, this one is punched down to him
calmly going about it are Canada, another comfortable single wide of midwicket
flicked away to deep midwicket, there is no penetration in Kenya's attack at the moment
goes outside off stump this time, and he defends off the front foot
gets to the pitch of this fuller one and drives back to Ngoche
turned away in front of square leg this time
whoa, this goes through everyone, sharp turn from way outside off stump, beats the batsman who went pushing forward, and too quick for the keeper
takes it on the pads as he tries to whip it away to square leg
tries to plonk this on the leg side and run, but cannot get it far from the fielder
now he turns it away fine, but short fine leg is there precisely for that
turning on the leg stump, but he cannot get the punch past midwicket
almost yorker length, but he wants the single dearly, digs it away wide of midwicket
Hansra stretches out and gets to the pitch of this delivery, swings it nice and straight down the ground for the first boundary in ages
played away on the leg side off the back foot
whipped away off the pads for a run down to fine leg
gets forward and across to one turning in from outside off stump, and smothers it on the off side, no problem with that one
gets bat and pad together and plays with the turn to midwicket
fired in quicker, pushed away towards mid off, bowler runs and fields
slapped away to extra cover, cannot get it past the infield
cuts this one away to cover off the back foot
turn and bounce from around off stump, he goes right back and punches it away to midwicket
gets the single finally, it was full and he happily drove it down the ground to long off
pushed through on the off stump, he gets forward and defends
flat and full on the stumps, driven back to the bowler
cut away to point off the back foot
turns sharply and hits him on the pads down the leg side, ball loops away on the leg side
pushed back down the track off the front foot
good one from Tikolo, a maiden to start off, another fuller one pushed back to him
whipped away off the back foot but finds midwicket in the way
turns and hits the bat on the inside edge and rolls away on the leg side
tapped in front of covers for a single
sharp turn and keeps low too, he adjusts to punch it to extra cover
the game is slipping away from Kenya, Canada get a couple of runs with a front foot drive that goes wide of cover
blocked without any issues down the track
down the track, takes on Tikolo, gets nicely close to the pitch and lofts it high over long off
turned in front of square leg for a single
gets the front foot forward and pushes this one in to the off side

the straighter one, almost got him, he pushed forward and got an outside edge that went fine on the off side, the fielder almost escorted the ball to the boundary, and puts in a half-hearted dive in the end to pull it back
gets a leading edge as he looks to play this to midwicket with the turn
gets a fuller one and drives it down the ground to long on
fired in on the stumps, he mistimes the ball as he looks to whip it away
uses the wrists to turn this one away towards midwicket
goes on the back foot and gets a single through square leg
sharp turn from outside off stump, it was cut away towards point, where the ball contrived to change its course past the fielder who made a mess of it
more turn from outside off stump, this time he plays with it towards midwicket
wanted to crash this through the covers, but mistimed it only as fas as extra cover
dips on him and turns to take the leading edge that falls well short of cover
Hansra wants the single that will take him to 50, turns this one on the leg side and hares across before Bagai sends him back
gets to his half-century now, and is mighty pleased with it, wristily turned it past midwicket
plays it down on the leg side and says 'no' to the non-striker
squeezed away backward of point who does some good work to stop the ball
cut away behind point off the back foot
he begins with a very poor delivery, slants down the leg side and gets tickled along to fine leg for four
short ball outside off, just scoots along at shin-height! Bagai defends off the back foot.
again on the pads, Bagai clips away backward of square leg for one
another one slips well down the leg side and is called a wide
on the pads, clipped fluently straight to midwicket
straigthter ball, defended down the track from off stump line
on the pads to end the over, defended solidly to mid on
tossed up on leg stump, driven with the spin to mid on for none
short and wide outside off, the cut goes straight to point
flighted on the pads again, the on-drive finds point
turning in from back of a length, he waits and dabs it with the spin to midwicket for one
gets half forward and defends from the crease. They are playing this cautiously
back of a length delivery on off stump, defended off the front foot down the track
short of a length again, gets some lift too off the track as Hansra presses forward to defend
this one angles into the pads and is tucked through midwicket fot one
shortish legcutter, breaks away off the straight and is steered to the off side for one
fuller, iniviting the drive and he leans into the shot. Straight to cover
another full one angling into the stumps and punched solidly to mid off
tossed up on the stumps, politely driven past Tikolo for the 100th run added by this pair
oh, bad ball, very bad ball. Drops short and wide outside off, Bagai happily hangs back and cracks it through the covers. Easy as they come, Canada are walking all over this one.
tossed up this time, Bagai reaches out to defend
and another four. Tikolo strays onto leg stump and Bagai gets the front foot across and lap-sweeps it along the way to fine leg.
this is patented tripe from Tikolo. Another delivery outside leg, Bagai could have let it be and got a wide, but he went to sweep. Short fine leg stopped it this time.
holds its line outside off, Bagai looks to guide it square, but picks out point
full delivery on off stump, driven straight to cover

lovely shot from Hansra. Full length delivery outside off, he ensured he opened the wrists on the cover drive to evade the fielder at cover. It seemed headed to the fence until Tanmay Mishra flew in the way in the deep.
short of a length on the line of middle and off, Hansra stays behind the line and defends down the track
another crisp cover drive, this time it is a text book shot and is stopped at cover
no need to do that Hansra. Looks to swat unnaturally across the line as Odhiambo lands one outside off on a length. And he misses.
he's really expressing himself out there. Waters will rue that drop for some days to come. Short ball outside off, Hansra stands up it and spanks the cut through point for four.
aha, big lbw appeal turned down. And not reviewed. Ngoche turns it big from outside off, as Bagai pushes his front foot well across and looks to work it to the leg side. Hmm,  may have been close.

Another appeal, this one is reviewed. This time, Bagai was looking to play it into the offside. It landed outside off and was breaking in, Bagai is hit in front of off, and the projection predicts that the outside half of the ball is hitting leg stump. That's not good enough for Umpire Rauf to change his call. Not out it is.
armer on the stumps, Bagai carefully deflects to the leg side for one
Hansra moves to the leg side, but this one turns in again, and gets his inside edge to the leg side for one
straying down the pads, whipped through square leg for a single
backs away again, and manufactures enough room to dink a single into the covers
Bagai has 50. Calm innings under pressure, and he's set up a famous win for his side. Chips inside the line of a full ball on the pads and clips it to the right of mid on for four.
he plays back to a length delivery and defends compactly to the bowler. Hmm, Hansra was backing up a long way and there may have been a run out if the bowler threw
back of a length on off stump, defended with an angled face to the off side

Canada let another chance go. Elijah throws to the wrong end. Bagai plays straight to mid off and takes off, Hansra was never decisive and was always in trouble. The throw went to the bowler's end though, and Bagai got there easy.

and a drop now. Odhiambo has put down his second return chance of the day and just like the previous one, this barely qualifies as a spill. Hansra thumped the length ball, on the up, straight at him. Odhiambo got his hands in place, but it did not stay in.
whumped. Slower ball at 106 kph, lands in the slot and Hansra dispatches it with a very well-timed pick up loft over long on. It lands on the boundary skirting, another inch in front and it was six.
tossed up outside off, and is driven against the spin into the covers
tossed up outside off again, Bagai drives fluently to long off for one
back of a length, punched without timing to mid on. The bowler tries to get across, and comically runs into the non-striker.
tossed up again outside off, driven quietly down the track
drifts onto middle and leg, worked to the leg side for no run
this one turns in sharply, Bagai covers the line and defends with the spin to square leg
Odhiambo lands one on the pads and Hansra clips to to mid on.
again on leg stump, Bagai clips through midwicket for another single
drifts into the pads, thrice in three balls, Hansra works it straight to midwicket

Hansra continues in his merry ways. He jumps out of the crease, opening up the off side for the carve, and Odhiambo helped with a full delivery outside off. Hansra just scythed with a flourish over point

after 70 impressive runs, Hansra is caught at mid on. There's no Waters there now to drop him. Ngoche holds on. Back of a length ball on off stump, certainly not there for the drive, but Hansra just goes through with the aerial on-drive. Doesn't middle it though, and it goes straight to Ngoche.
a yorker down the leg side, wasted and nearly wided. It hit the batsman's pad on the way and is hence not called a wide
full and on the pads, as always Bagai clips through midwicket for one more
whoa, Tyson feels lazily at a ball angled across him. Some noise as it went through, it was of the bat hitting the pad.
wider outside off, Tyson lets it go through to the keeper
Elijah knows just how far he can go before being called a wide. The previous ball was wider than the one before. This one is even wider, and is called.
more exercise for Umpire Rauf as Elijah lands this a metre outside off.
yorker a foot outside off, Tyson looks to steer to the off side, but can't get bat on ball
finally gets one to dip in towards the batsman, who defends into the off side
the entire gamuts of line in that over, this one slips down the leg side and is glanced to fine leg for one.
full ball on the stumps, played solidly back at the bowler who has a needless shy at thr stumps at the batting end. Frustration, clearly.
Tyson angles the face and steers a full ball very fine. Third man does well to keep it down to two
short ball, not much lift from the deck as Tyson ducks disconcertingly

the Kotla is not going to bounce much any more. Banged in short, this one scoots along and Tyson ends up looking a little out of his depth as he aborts the decision to duck and ends up getting hit on the glove, which is just above the upper flap of the pad.

Aha, Kenya are down, but not yet out. Odhiambo has bowled Tyson round the legs. He delivers it full and on leg stump from over the wicket, Tyson shuffles too far across in search of the tickle to fine leg and misses. Leg stump is hit, Odhiambo is thrilled.
Odhiambo delivers a friendly full delivery outside off, Davison reaches out and cracks it through the covers. Crisp and clean.
and another four, Canada get even closer as Elijah sprays another one on the pads. Bagai must be excited in anticipation of a famous win, he helps this along to fine leg for four
short of a length on off stump, forced off the back foot towards point
that's just how wrong the slower ball can go. Slips out, literally walks down the 22 yards, and ends up two metres down the leg side, and Bagai can't even get close to it with the attempt at the pull

Canada have doubled their number of wins in World Cups. Bagai has played a top innings here, and fittingly ends it all with a thumped carve over the off side. That shot underlines just how much better Canada have been better today, from the time Osinde picked those early wickets.
